value.title: Easily add query parameters to your source paths - Power BI Tips & Tricks #16
value.excerpt: In this tutorial, I show you how to easily add query parameters into your source paths using the advance editor function.   Looking for a download file? Go to our Download Center: https://curbal.com/donwload-center  SUBSCRIBE to learn more about Power and Excel BI! https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCJ7UhloHSA4wAqPzyi6TOkw?sub_confirmation=1

value.title: How to do Pagination on a REST API in Power Query (Part 1)
value.excerpt: In today's video, I am going to show you how to implement pagination when the number of pages or records to be returned are known.   Chapters: 00:00 Intro 00:30 Not all APIs have the same structure 01:10 Get data from World Bank API 01:45 How pagination works on the API 02:30 Hardcode the number of pages

value.title: Intro to data modeling (Part2): Snowflake vs star vs galaxy schemes in Power BI

value.title: Part 1: Get Europe's data in Power BI with Eurostat API - @EU_Eurostat
value.excerpt: Have you ever wanted to get data about Europe in Power BI to boost your market research? Population in Europe, Age and gender, income levels, employment levels, all this is available for you if you connect to Eurostats API.  In this video I will show you how the API works and in the next we will build

value.title: Running totals by subcategory in Power Query!!
value.excerpt: I showed you on last monday's video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=uX3_dnb5on0 how to do running totals in power query, and in this video I will show you how to do it but by subcategory or group. value.title: Running totals in power query??? Yes, you can :)
value.excerpt: In today's video, I am going to show you how you can do running totals or cummulative totals in Power Query, but do this only if you have no way to do it using DAX.  Also, I will show you how List.Range work, really cool function :)  Here you can download all the pbix files: https://curbal.com/donwload-center

value.title: Schedule data downloads / exports in Power BI
value.excerpt: You can export data or download data out of Power BI in many different ways and depending on the source, you can schedule refresh those data dumps too.   In this video, I will give you one example on how to do that.  Other resources mentioned in this video: Export data with DAX Studio: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=-Gfgnk6R0Qw

value.title: Power BI Tutorial: Dynamically Filter By Today's Date
value.excerpt: In this Power BI Tutorial, Patrick looks at how to dynamically filter by today's date. Using a date table, you can create a DAX measure that can then be used as a Power BI report-level filter to dynamically filter by today's date within Power BI Desktop.be  LET'S CONNECT! value.title: Using R Visuals with Power BI
value.excerpt: You can take advantage of the R Script showcase to start using R Visuals with your reports. value.title: Where to create your columns in Power BI | Data Modeling Best Practices
